intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum var. villarsii, commonly known as the Alpine cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
